column1: Columbia University (Fu Foundation School Of Engineering)
column14: Was rejected from PhD (no surprise as admissions had gone out a long time ago) but was directed to apply for the (unfunded) masters program. The application for masters was super easy; just email, name, and birthday.
To the poster below, did you receive a notification when your recommender received verification mail? Also anyone got any result for the MSOR program?
I've had an interview roughly a month ago ans i've received nothing since. Should i condsider it hopeless? Thanks

To the other UT Austin IEOR PhD admit: Did you get confirmation that you were accepted to the PhD program? I applied for the PhD program but did not receive any communication from the department. I gave them a call and was notified that I had actually been admitted to the masters program. Emailed a professor to clarify. Pretty upset that they would reject me from doctoral program but not give me notice... instead misleading me by telling me I had been accepted to a program for which I did not apply.

I got that email a few weeks back and the wait was killing me so I finally decided to call the department. With very little hassle they told me I was on the wait list and told me my position on the list as well as the fact they are expecting to have a class of 10 people (so they accept more than 10 based on yield). This is actually great news because now I'm not waiting in limbo and I know exactly what happened. I assume the other folks who got that email are also on the waitlist!
Email came from graduate school department (not ORIE) and told to check website
TTPB: I also haven't heard back. I don't know what's going on anymore ...
Has anyone received any sort of communication from the IEOR Dept regarding the date of outcome?

Anyone hear anything? We got that email two weeks ago now and some rejections, a few acceptances, and Masters degree results have come out. The wait is killing me! Website says mid march and I guess we're coming up on mid March now. Come on, Cal!

3a/1r/4p First rejection  which is honestly kind of a relief (great program but 3rd on the list because of program location and faculty specializations). GPA 2.83, Maj GPA 3.03. Strong LORs from a long known fine arts prof, my stochastics prof, and an employer. A few special projects (creating and lecturing at two field related symposiums). Def not surprised but still a little bummed. Had really positive contact with Dr. Yunan Liu so talk to him if you have any questions! Best of luck to the other applicants!
People who have got admission and not willing to attend, please withdraw when you are sure. Thank you!

3 years in Classes préparatoires (highly competitive French program)
2 years in top tier Engineering  school (Centrale Paris)
1 summer research internship in NLP
1 semester at Berkeley in IEOR
1 research internship at Mila in Deep RL
Excellent academic results and great recommendation letters
A lot of entrepreneurship experience
Overall I would say I have a very multidisciplinary profile but not a lot of research experience. Rather an extreme diversity of projects I have done.

To the post below, yes, I applied for Cornell Ithaca. Data Analytics concentration.

The department has recommended to complete additional coursework in proof-based probability theory. They have also recommended to participate in Cornell's Master of Engineering Summer English Immersion Program.

I regret to inform you that your application for admission to the Ph.D. program in Operations Research at Cornell University for the Fall 2018 term has not been approved. Since the number of students we can accommodate is limited and the overall quality of applicants has been exceptionally high this year, it is not possible for us to accept all of the fine students who are interested in coming to Cornell.

Thank you for your interest in our program. I wish you success in your future endeavors!

Sincerely,

Jim Dai, PhD
Leon C. Welch Professor of Engineering

Received the same e-mail as the MIT ORC poster below: "This year the Operations Research Center... graduate degree program in Operations Research."

This year the Operations Research Center received a large number of applications from outstanding candidates, and we are in the unfortunate situation of having many more qualified applicants than we have spaces in our program. Therefore, even though your credentials are very strong, we regret that we are unable to offer you admission to the interdepartmental
graduate degree program in Operations Research.
Didn't really expect them to get back to me this fast. I thought they will send out notification in March.  :)

Recently talked to the co-director of the grad program over the phone and was told that even though my qualifications are strong, my background (economics) and research interests (mechanism design) don't fit to the program. I have to admit they're right, I'm very peripheral to them. But I thought it was worth a try.
